meanings.definition: The act of officially cancelling or invalidating something.
meanings.sent1: The revocation of his driver's license was a serious consequence.
meanings.sent2: The revocation of the contract was necessary due to the breach of terms.
meanings.sent3: After the revocation of his dessert privileges, he felt quite disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The revocation of her access key left her feeling locked out of the system.
meanings.sent5: The revocation of the permission slip meant she couldn't go on the field trip.

meanings.definition: The official cancellation of a law, decree, or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The revocation of the outdated law was a step towards progress.
meanings.sent2: The revocation of the treaty led to diplomatic tensions between the countries.
meanings.sent3: The revocation of the bedtime rule was met with cheers from the children.
meanings.sent4: The revocation of the policy created a ripple effect throughout the organization.
meanings.sent5: The revocation of the curfew brought a sense of freedom to the neighborhood.
